case_vignette: A 51-year-old woman comes to the physician because of fatigue and progressive pain and stiffness in her hands for 3 months. She used to play tennis but stopped 1 month ago because of difficulties holding the racket and her skin becoming “very sensitive to sunlight.” Her last menstrual period was 1 year ago. She has diabetes mellitus controlled with insulin. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. Vital signs are within normal limits. The patient appears tanned. The second and third metacarpophalangeal joints of both hands are tender to palpation and range of motion is limited.
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Order antinuclear antibody (ANA) and anti-double-stranded DNA (anti-dsDNA) antibody tests.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing fatigue, progressive pain and stiffness in my hands, and my skin has become very sensitive to sunlight.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for 3 months.
Do you have any history of other autoimmune diseases, either in yourself or in your family?
I have diabetes mellitus, but I do not have information on any other autoimmune diseases in my family.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as rashes, red or dry eyes, or mouth ulcers?
No, I have not noticed any rashes, red or dry eyes, or mouth ulcers.
Have you had any joint swelling or noticed any changes in the color or appearance of your fingers when exposed to cold?
No, I haven't experienced joint swelling or changes in the color or appearance of my fingers when exposed to cold.
Are you currently taking any medications for your symptoms?
No, I am not taking any medications for these symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient has reported long-term symptoms including fatigue, progressive pain and stiffness in the hands, and increased skin sensitivity to sunlight over the past three months. The patient has a history of diabetes mellitus but lacks any broader information regarding a family history of autoimmune diseases. Further inquiry revealed that the patient had neither observed any rashes, red or dry eyes, nor mouth ulcers, nor reported experiencing joint swelling or changes in finger color or appearance when exposed to cold temperatures. Additionally, the patient confirmed not being on any medications to address these symptoms.
trial_0.summarized_frq: Order ANA (antinuclear antibody) and anti-Ro/SSA and anti-La/SSB antibodies tests.

trial_1.vignette_frq: Order anti-nuclear antibody (ANA) and anti-double-stranded DNA (anti-dsDNA) tests.
